channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Tom Lynch has refused to blame his recently repaired hand for modest output in recent weeks. The Richmond star has kicked just two goals in his last three games, averaging five disposals in that period.
item.title: Lynch won't blame hand injury for modest returns

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 532 new COVID-19 cases as Epping Gardens, Thai Rock clusters grow, Australian death toll jumps to 161

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: A tourist who was visiting his girlfriend in Sydney got her housemate drunk and sexually assaulted her while his girlfriend was out, a court has been told.
item.title: Tourist plied girlfriend's housemate with alcohol before sexual assault, court told

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Workers, including casuals, in aged care are likely to receive two weeks of paid leave to encourage them to stay home if they have COVID-19 symptoms.
item.title: Aged care workers across Australia will be given paid pandemic leave

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Hawthorn coach Alastair Clarkson is set to be hit with a 'please explain' from the AFL after his dig at the umpires, whose professional association took a veiled swipe at the legendary coach on Monday.
item.title: Umps take veiled swipe at Clarkson with AFL to issue 'please explain'

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: Latest revelations from a joint investigation into Australia's workers compensation system.
item.title: 'They treated me like a leper': How workers' comp claims were rejected

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The Australian Major Performing Arts Group had been considering a change in direction until "COVID hit and everything changed overnight".
item.title: 'The way is cleared for a new unified voice': peak arts group folds

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: The US is inviting Australia to join a dangerous campaign against China. We can stand up to China without backing Donald Trump's self-serving campaign for re-election.
item.title: Australia should yield neither to Xi nor Trump

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Carlton football department chief Brad Lloyd has confirmed he will raise the rough treatment of Patrick Cripps with the AFL’s umpiring department this week, stressing that the league’s best ball hunters deserve to be protected.
item.title: Hands off: Blues' plea for Cripps to be protected

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Emergency services were called to the blaze just before 3pm to find the upper floor of the two-storey building engulfed.
item.title: House fire in Brisbane leaves man with leg burns

item.description: Worryingly, these restrictions place far greater responsibility on new mothers to "do it all" at a time when they are most vulnerable.
item.title: Two-hour hospital limit a bitter blow for newborn parents

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Back from the brink, Carriageworks is opening to the public next Friday with a major performance installation critiquing cyber-surveillance.
item.title: Carriageworks re-opening set to reveal the internet's dark side

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: The pressure on the teen has been huge since reports emerged of a cross-code battle for his signature. Rugby Australia feels the family has been spooked by the coverage.
item.title: 'Really nasty': Rugby foundation boss slams Souths' handling of Suaalii deal

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: It comes as Victoria recorded its highest daily total, with 532 COVID-19 cases and six deaths.
item.title: Case linked to second inner-city restaurant as Queensland threatens to shut border

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Treasurer Josh Frydenberg should look beyond what Ronald Reagan and Margaret Thatcher did, but heed the political prowess that let them to do it.
item.title: Bold political leadership needed to fashion economic recovery

item.dc:creator: Nick Ralston
item.description: NSW Attorney-General Mark Speakman said any decision on raising the age of criminal responsibility had been deferred to 2021.
item.title: Age of criminal responsibility to remain at 10 until at least 2021

item.description: The development on Phnom Penh's outskirts will reduce the wetlands to less than a tenth of its 1500 hectares, impoverish thousands of farming and fishing families.
item.title: 1000 families facing eviction as wetlands make room for garden city

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: A veteran Hawthorn official says anyone who worked in footy from 1986 into the '90s knew salary cap rorts were widespread, while the Hawks took an AFL amnesty.
item.title: Many clubs rorted salary cap, league knew: veteran Hawk official

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: A spike in deaths attributed to flu and pneumonia has sparked concerns that COVID-19 deaths may have been misdiagnosed in Australia, indicating that there could be higher levels of community transmission than believed.
item.title: Rise in pneumonia deaths sparks concern about misdiagnosed COVID-19

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Aged care industry bodies argue if they are forced to give their staff paid pandemic leave at their own cost they could have too few workers available.
item.title: Victorian nursing homes forced to call in staff from other states

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The Colac Otway Shire wants tougher restrictions to prevent the virus tightening its grip on the south-west town.
item.title: Colac hospital braced for COVID-19 cases to surge as community transmission hits

item.description: The gelded son of prolific wet-track producer I Am Invincible lines up for his second start for Wauchope trainer Colt Prosser on a heavy track at Taree.
item.title: Stable move puts perennial bridesmaid Highbury front and centre

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Perpetual chief Rob Adams says the $465 million purchase of American fund manager Barrow Hanley is a response to investors' growing hunger for offshore assets.
item.title: 'Weight of money': Perpetual goes global in $465m US deal

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Bubs Australia chief executive Kristy Carr is confident the company can deliver healthy revenue growth in 2020-21 despite a 5 per cent decline in the June quarter.
item.title: Bubs boss sees healthy growth despite coronavirus hit to sales

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: NSW Treasurer Dominic Perrottet said concerns about icare's financial viability and performance were "not new".
item.title: NSW Treasurer stands by icare after millions in underpayment revealed

item.description: The president of the Australian Human Rights Commission puts paid to those who who invoke human rights as a reason to refuse to wear a mask - such as a Bunnings customer who confronted staff in a Victorian store,
item.title: Wearing a mask will protect human liberties, not infringe upon them

item.description: The ruling on Tuesday will have a rippling effect on other corruption cases and send a signal about the strength of Malaysia's legal system.
item.title: Corruption verdict for Malaysia's Najib Razak a test of rule of law

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Transdev Sydney Light Rail confirmed the tram had been derailed after the collision - with "major damage" to its side.
item.title: Tram badly damaged after collision with truck in George Street

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: Australian Foundation Investment Company has booked a hefty drop in income after many listed companies cancelled their dividend payouts amid the first wave of the pandemic.
item.title: 'Fully invested': AFIC props up final payout, waits for value to return to ASX

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: The NSW Court of Appeal has upheld a decision granting a prohibition order over the rally, planned for inner Sydney on Tuesday.
item.title: NSW's top court rejects Sydney Black Lives Matter protest appeal

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on a seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race guide and tips for Taree on Tuesday

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Brisbane Times understands the man passed through screening and checkpoints during which it was discovered he was wanted on a return-to-prison warrant.
item.title: Man flees airport on foot after being caught in coronavirus checkpoint

item.description: West Coast made a big statement with their win over Collingwood on Sunday. But while the Eagles were impressive, what does it say about the Pies?
item.title: Real Footy podcast: 'That isn't an outlier ... that's a common thread'

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: NSW coastal residents from Stockton south to the Victorian border, including near Sydney, face damaging erosion on Monday and Tuesday as powerful surf combines with high tides.
item.title: Coastal NSW on high alert as low pressure system stirs big swells

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Vaping is likely to be banned in 11 areas in Melbourne's CBD and surrounds where cigarette smoking is already banned, including the Bourke Street Mall and The Tan and Princes Park running tracks.
item.title: Vaping likely to be banned in Melbourne CBD's smoke-free zones

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: The acquisition by one challenged value funds manager of another challenged value funds manager looks like doubling down on a business with structural problems.
item.title: Perpetual goes on US shopping spree to buy earnings growth

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The teen at the centre of a cross-code tug of war appears set to take his talents to Redfern, and could play his first NRL game before he turns 18.
item.title: NRL will 'absolutely' consider allowing Suaalii to make early debut for Souths

item.description: It sustains some 30 million people across eight countries, moving supplies, people and industry deep into forested regions. It is also bringing disease.
item.title: The Amazon River, a life source, is also unleashing the pandemic

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police say a 4WD carrying four people was travelling along a beach at low tide when it rolled. It comes after a crash on the Gold Coast claimed four young lives.
item.title: NSW man dies in Fraser Island rollover as police probe hinterland fatality

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: The issues raised by the Black Summer fires require major reform and will be challenging to fit into the bushfire royal commission's timeframe, experts warn, despite the two-month extension of its reporting deadline.
item.title: 'Massive' issues expected to test bushfire royal commission deadline

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Opposition Leader Deb Frecklington has unveiled another part of her water and economic plans ahead of October's election.
item.title: LNP to cut farmers' water prices by 20 per cent

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: 'Very challenging numbers': Victoria has recorded its biggest daily tally of new cases of coronavirus, 532. Six more people have died, five of them in aged care homes.
item.title: New cases hit fresh peak, Andrews warns high-risk industries may shut

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: In this episode, national editor Tory Maguire is joined by investigative journalist Adele Ferguson to discuss a joint investigation by The Herald, The Age and Four Corners into Australia's $60 billion workers’ compensation system.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: the mismanagement of Australia's $60 billion workers' comp system

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: The addition of rugby league royalty and the hiring of a savvy coach on the rise were key factors in the successful raid for Brisbane's lost star.
item.title: Why Fifita's switch to Titans is more about Meninga than money

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: Collapsed swimwear brand Seafolly is likely to be sold back to the same owners that first placed the business into administration.
item.title: Swimwear brand Seafolly set to be sold back to original owners

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Rats are taking advantage of Melbourne's lockdown; dining at empty restaurant tables, nesting in closed pilates studios with some even leaving the city altogether.
item.title: Rat-catchers say city's rodents 'going crazy', heading for the 'burbs

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: A video shot by a customer claiming a human rights defence for not wearing a mask is a triumph ... for the Bunnings workers she confronted.
item.title: Human rights abuses in the paint aisle at Bunnings? Yeah, right

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: Researchers are calling for volunteers for a study into whether obesity and diabetes cause more severe symptoms of the disease.
item.title: Queensland COVID patients wanted for study into link with diabetes

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: About 8000 Cairns residents have lost their jobs since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Tourism industry warns second Queensland lockdown would 'break our spirit'
